CatDescriptText: George Dugan, 304 Freeland Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the house, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "Yes, because they do their chores.  This way, they can go to the shows or enjoy other recreation.  It helps them to develop and to know what's right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Dugan wearing light colored short sleeved shirt with sword and shield pattern, standing in front of C.C. Mellor store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown
